3cffc617-38a0-4d48-a1d5-9d2f5ff6f169.description: Earners of the CompTIA Security+ certification have the knowledge and skills necessary to perform core security functions required of any cybersecurity role. CompTIA Security+ professionals know how to identify and address potential threats, attacks and vulnerabilities and they have established techniques in risk management, risk mitigation, threat management and intrusion detection.
3cffc617-38a0-4d48-a1d5-9d2f5ff6f169.name: CompTIA Security+ ce Certification

Achieve a passing score on the CompTIA Security+ performance-based exam.
Complete continuing education requirements for renewal.

e8dbe3e8-ca1f-453d-b669-c1265244655b.description: Earners of the CompTIA A+ certification are proven problem solvers who are able to perform critical IT support tasks including device configuration, data backup and recovery, and operating system configuration. CompTIA A+ certified professionals have demonstrated baseline security skills for IT support roles and are able to detect and remove malware, address privacy concerns, and troubleshoot core service challenges.
e8dbe3e8-ca1f-453d-b669-c1265244655b.name: CompTIA A+ ce Certification

41a8e2db-ae33-4533-ab6f-c98e252d6368.description: Earners of the CompTIA Network+ certification have the skills needed to troubleshoot, configure, and manage wired and wireless networks found in companies around the world. CompTIA Network+ professionals have demonstrated the ability to design and implement functional networks, configure, manage, and maintain essential network devices, implement network security, and troubleshoot network problems.

51aa930a-cb26-4a1f-b3b8-6891fd09d161.description: Earners of the CompTIA ITF+ certification have the knowledge and skills required to identify and explain the basics of computing, IT infrastructure, application and software, software development, database fundamentals, and security. 4d29f7c3-8cd3-4c6a-88ff-b9608eb30745.description: The CompTIA CASP+ certification is an advanced-level cybersecurity certification covering technical skills in security architecture and senior security engineering in cloud, on premises and hybrid environments. 2677832a-8420-40bf-a0d2-3714ef737134.description: CompTIA Security+ earners who certified prior to January 1, 2011, have a Security+ considered good-for-life (GFL). It does not expire and does not have CE requirements. Earners of the CompTIA Security+ GFL understand network and data security principles that would help them build a general awareness of security threats and to understand basic principles of securing a network.

c3c70742-cf5f-4bec-baed-3a835c921860.description: Earners of the CompTIA PenTest+ certification have the knowledge and skills necessary to perform hands-on penetration testing to identify, exploit, report and manage vulnerabilities on a network. CompTIA PenTest+ professionals have demonstrated the hands-on ability and knowledge to find vulnerabilities in newer environments such as cloud and hybrid, web applications, embedded devices, as well as traditional desktops and servers. These skills help organizations comply to regulations.

ff2cf594-2682-45d1-83e8-32e185566fa3.description: Earners of the CompTIA Data+ have the knowledge and skills required to drive data-driven decision-making through mining and manipulating data, applying basic statistical methods, and analyzing complex datasets while adhering to governance and quality standards throughout the entire data life cycle.

355c86d5-d12a-4c67-abe8-1dd90b47888b.description: Earners of the CompTIA CTT+ Classroom Trainer certification have the necessary skills and knowledge to prepare, present, facilitate and evaluate a training session. These instructors have demonstrated the ability to plan engaging classroom lectures, practice tasks and exams, and they are knowledgeable and effective communicators.
355c86d5-d12a-4c67-abe8-1dd90b47888b.name: CompTIA CTT+ Classroom Trainer Certification

a98149e3-8ff0-40ba-b61d-5e9d4bb9c41f.description: The CompTIA Subject Matter Expert (SME) badge attests that the SME is in good standing and has attended at least one (1) workshop in the past three years. CompTIA Subject Matter Experts are individuals who have been approved by an internal review board to represent specific CompTIA products (e.g. certifications) based on relevant and strong expertise, as well as knowledge and experience in particular areas.
a98149e3-8ff0-40ba-b61d-5e9d4bb9c41f.name: CompTIA Subject Matter Expert

alignments.name: Exam Development
alignments.description: CompTIA exams are built by the industry, for the industry. We draw the content for the exams from industry-wide survey feedback and contributions from our team of SMEs. The result is a rigorous exam development process representing thousands of hours spent building high-quality competency standards that meet the needs of the industry.

alignments.name: ANSI National Accreditation Board: ISO/IEC 17024
alignments.description: CompTIA A+, CompTIA Advanced Security Practitioner, CompTIA Cloud+, CompTIA Cybersecurity Analyst, CompTIA Linux+, CompTIA Network+, CompTIA PenTest+, and CompTIA Security+ certifications are accredited by the ANSI National Accreditation Board (ANAB) under the ISO 17024 standard.

badge_template_activities.title: The purpose of SMEs is to assist in the development phases of CompTIA’s certification exams. Each workshop consists of approximately five (5) days, or forty (40) hours, of development work, including, but not limited to Job Task Analysis, Objective Development, Item Writing, Item Review, and Cut Score workshops.

bf20c9a6-6bff-4201-8957-4b79ef956e1b.description: The CompTIA SME Technical Advisory Committee (CSTAC) is comprised of Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) in excellent standing who have demonstrated a strong expertise in specific technology areas and who have proven their ability to lead and work well in a workshop type setting with other professionals.
bf20c9a6-6bff-4201-8957-4b79ef956e1b.name: CompTIA Certification SME Technical Advisory Committee

alignments.name: Exam Development
alignments.description: CompTIA exams are built by the industry, for the industry. We draw the content for the exams from industry-wide survey feedback and contributions from our team of SMEs. The result is a rigorous exam development process representing thousands of hours spent building high-quality competency standards that meet the needs of the industry.

alignments.name: ANSI National Accreditation Board: ISO/IEC 17024
alignments.description: CompTIA A+, CompTIA Advanced Security Practitioner, CompTIA Cloud+, CompTIA Cybersecurity Analyst, CompTIA Linux+, CompTIA Network+, CompTIA PenTest+, and CompTIA Security+ certifications are accredited by the ANSI National Accreditation Board (ANAB) under the ISO 17024 standard.

badge_template_activities.title: Members of CSTAC are Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) approved by an internal review board comprised of industry professionals. CSTAC members have attended at least three workshops in the past three years and have committed to attending at least two additional workshops in the next two years. Each workshop consists of approximately five (5) days, or forty (40) hours, of development work, including Job Task Analysis, Objective Development, Item Writing/Review, and Cut Score Workshops.

f8f36495-9172-4bf7-9dee-f16149bea7d5.description: Earners of the CompTIA Certification Advisory Committee (CAC) badge demonstrate leadership in annual CAC meetings and activities. CAC members are selected for their expertise and influence in the IT industry. They provide advice and guidance to CompTIA regarding the strategic direction of the industry's leading IT certifications.
f8f36495-9172-4bf7-9dee-f16149bea7d5.name: CompTIA Certification Advisory Committee

alignments.name: Certification Development
alignments.description: CompTIA certifications are built by the industry, for the industry. We draw the content for the exam objectives from industry-wide feedback and contributions. The result is a rigorous exam objective development process to build high-quality competency standards that meet the needs of the industry.

alignments.name: ANSI National Accreditation Board: ISO/IEC 17024
alignments.description: CompTIA A+, CompTIA Advanced Security Practitioner (CASP+), CompTIA Cloud+, CompTIA Cybersecurity Analyst (CySA+), CompTIA Linux+, CompTIA Network+, CompTIA PenTest+, and CompTIA Security+ certifications are accredited by the ANSI National Accreditation Board (ANAB) under the ISO 17024 standard.

badge_template_activities.title: Provide advice and guidance to CompTIA regarding the relevance and accuracy of CompTIA certifications.
Participate in at least 75% of CAC review meetings and activities annually.
Agree to the CompTIA CAC code of conduct.

70185d5a-3b39-4af1-9338-2ea22061e595.description: The CompTIA Certification Governance Committee (GC) is a select group of individuals who have displayed advanced expertise in specific technology areas, demonstrated their ability to lead in workshop-type settings, and shown impartiality through their actions. The purpose of this committee is to ensure CompTIA certifications remain fair, accurate, and current by providing support and expertise in a timely fashion during the development of the CompTIA certification exams.
70185d5a-3b39-4af1-9338-2ea22061e595.name: CompTIA Certification Governance Committee

alignments.name: Exam Development
alignments.description: CompTIA exams are built by the industry, for the industry. We draw the content for the exams from industry-wide survey feedback and contributions from our team of SMEs. The result is a rigorous exam development process representing thousands of hours spent building high-quality competency standards that meet the needs of the industry.

alignments.name: ANSI National Accreditation Board: ISO/IEC 17024
alignments.description: CompTIA A+, CompTIA Advanced Security Practitioner, CompTIA Cloud+, CompTIA Cybersecurity Analyst, CompTIA Linux+, CompTIA Network+, CompTIA PenTest+, and CompTIA Security+ certifications are accredited by the ANSI National Accreditation Board (ANAB) under the ISO 17024 standard.

badge_template_activities.title: The CompTIA Certification Governance Committee (GC) is comprised of industry experts who have demonstrated integral leadership while governing CompTIA’s exam development efforts. Members of this committee have dedicated years to developing and governing CompTIA’s exams.
